pr_title: Add Intel SGX support to Unikraft
pr_body:
### Prerequisite checklist

 - [x] Read the [contribution guidelines](https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/) regarding submitting new changes to the project;
 - [x] Tested your changes against relevant architectures and platforms;
 - [ ] Ran the [`checkpatch.pl`](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/support/scripts/checkpatch.pl) on your commit series before opening this PR;
 - [ ] Updated relevant documentation.


### Base target

 - Architecture(s): `x86_64`
 - Platform(s): `kvm`
 - Application(s): N/A


### Additional configuration

 - `CONFIG_ARCH_X86_64_SGX=y`
 - `CONFIG_KVM_RING3=1`


### Description of changes

This PR is for adding Intel SGX support to Unikraft. It also introduces some tiny modifications on the GDT/TSS part to provide experimental ring-3 support, because SGX ENCLU instruction must be executed under ring-3.

### Introduction

This library `uksgx` provides the SGX driver, SDK and platform software (PSW, aka runtime), to provide a basic SGX functionality to Unikraft, which allows an enclave in the CPU to be executed securely at native speed. The enclave memory is not encrypted and can only be accessed by the enclave itself, guaranteed by the MMU inside the CPU package. Enclave runs at ring-3 only, hence no system calls are allowed. The enclave is linked statically and is self-contained with the pre-compiled SDK libraries.

A device `/dev/sgx` is registered to the devfs with the following IOCTL commands (for compatibility consideration):
- SGX_IOC_ENCLAVE_CREATE: validate user parameters and invoke ECREATE instruction
- SGX_IOC_ENCLAVE_ADD_PAGE: invoke EADD to add REG/TCS pages into the enclave and invoke EEXTEND to generate cryptographic hashes of the contents in the enclave
- SGX_IOC_ENCLAVE_INIT: verify enclave's content against signed SIGSTRUCT and initialize the enclave, then mark it ready to be used via EINIT instruction

After creation/loading/initialization, app/enclave can invoke EENTER/EEXIT/ERESUME to control the in/out of the enclave. Those switches are handled by `sgx_ocall()` and `sgx_ecall()`, which is wrapped in the SDK.

### Timeline
It is only a drafted PR and lots of work is required to be done. At the final time, I will squash the commits and do some cleanup before submitting the formal PR.
- 11 Jun 2022: At the time of the first draft, the probing of SGX is finished, that is to say, Unikraft can be aware of SGX if enabled in `make menuconfig`. And as inspired by [linux-sgx-driver](https://github.com/intel/linux-sgx-driver), the uksgx library registers a device /dev/sgx to the devfs, and some stub ioctl function is added to the library, in order to provide a unified and easy interaction channel between uksgx and the applications.
- 23 Jun 2022: As of today, the experimental ring-3 support dedicated to the SGX driver is finished when paging is enabled. Both paging and ring-3 are the fundamental features for SGX support.
- 7 Jul 2022: The EPC physical area is successfully mapped to the virtual address area given a hardcoded `SGX_VA_OFFSET` as its beginning address. This should be refined when the function for finding a usable VA area is implemented.
- 25 Jul 2022: `sgx_encl_create` is finished. Seems VMA is not available to Unikraft. So we need to interact with the page table using raw APIs for page management.
- 16 Aug 2022: #520 is online. This PR introduces a radix-tree implementation, which is required by SGX driver to manage the EPC pages.
- 8 Sep 2022: As of commit `ea1e61e`, the SGX driver is ported, except for implementations of a. VMA management; b. interruptible sleep and c. synchronized EPC page adding. Those, especially for the VMA management required a thorough review and understanding of the Unikraft's memory implementation, which requires lots of time. Hence I am going to work on the SGX SDK first.
- 14 Sep 2022: 
  1.  SDK is ported to Unikraft. Once `uksgx` is enabled, the SGX SDK will be compiled to some static libraries (`libsgx_tstdc.a`, `libsgx_tcxx.a` and `libsgx_tservice.a`) by default.
  2. Update this PR to add a basic introduction of Intel SGX implementation in Unikraft

I will perform a simplification and clarification once we reach a great milestone of this project, say make a "hello world" work from SGX.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 7, 10, 9, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'xymeng16', 'type': 'User'}]
